  5. Birds

    In a series of quick, deliberate movements, a song sparrow shifts, balances, and surveys the clearing — part vigilance, part rhythm.

    Perching Birds
    The songbirds and sitters of branches and fences.

    Perching birds - or passerines - bring color and melody to woodlands, fields and backyards.
    Raptors
    Hunters of the open sky and silent forests.

    Raptors command the air with precision and power.
    Tree Clinging
    Specialists of bark and vertical motion.

    Woodpeckers, nuthatches, and creepers hammering and probing in search of insects.
    Wading Birds
    Poise and reflection at the water's edge.

    Wading birds inhabit the boundaries between land and water.
